helpdesk_ticket.description_html:
Dear PharmEasy Support Team,
I am writing about my return pickup for Order ID 645827800393052160-R-706 (Tracking ID: 9148880367323, Courier Partner: Delhivery).
Unfortunately, during the pickup, I mistakenly handed the pickup executive my black jeans instead of the medicine that was meant to be returned. The delivery/pickup executive accepted the packet and proceeded further. I kindly request your immediate assistance with the following:
  1. Locate and return my black jeans to my address as soon as possible. This item was given by mistake and is of personal value to me.
  2. Arrange a new pickup for the correct return item (medicine) at the earliest convenient time. Please confirm the pickup slot and the name/ID of the pickup executive before they arrive.
For your reference:
  • Order ID: 645827800393052160-R-706
  • Tracking ID: 9148880367323
  • Courier Partner: Delhivery
  • Pickup date/time (original): [29/12/2025]
Please let me know the next steps and a timeline for retrieving my jeans and collecting the medicine. I am available at the phone number below for any clarifications or to coordinate with the pickup team.
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your confirmation and a quick resolution.
Warm regards,
Deepak Goyal
Mobile: 9827929503

With regards to your order #653238483967369216-38598, as checked due to some unforeseen circumstances, the order was not delivered to you by the expected date of delivery. Please accept my apologies for the same.     As per the records, your order is delivered to you on 02nd December 2025. We have jotted down the details of your experience and PharmEasy will ensure all appropriate actions are taken to prevent similar situations from happening in the future.     We look forward to having an opportunity to serve you in the future.     We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us. Have a great day ahead!     Regards,  PharmEasy
notes.body_html:
Hello Yashswee,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

With regards to your order #653238483967369216-38598, as checked due to some unforeseen circumstances, the order was not delivered to you by the expected date of delivery. Please accept my apologies for the same.

As per the records, your order is delivered to you on 02nd December 2025. We have jotted down the details of your experience and PharmEasy will ensure all appropriate actions are taken to prevent similar situations from happening in the future.

We look forward to having an opportunity to serve you in the future.

We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.

For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section. 

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!

Regards,
PharmEasy

notes.body: Hello Chintanika,     Greetings from PharmEasy!  ​   With regards to the promotional notifications, we always try to keep our customers updated on our offers. However, we apologize for the inconvenience caused due to our promotional messages.   Please be assured, I have forwarded your request to unsubscribe your number '9712534048' from getting the promotional notifications. It will take 3 working days to process it completely. You will only receive your order-related information.   Further, if you wish to unsubscribe from getting the promotional notifications on your email id too, I request you to open your latest promotional email and hit unsubscribe at the bottom right-hand side corner to stop email promotions.   I certainly hope this helps and appreciate your understanding and patience in the meanwhile.   ​   For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.     Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.     Regards,  Manisha
notes.body_html:
Hello Chintanika,

Greetings from PharmEasy!
​
With regards to the promotional notifications, we always try to keep our customers updated on our offers. However, we apologize for the inconvenience caused due to our promotional messages.

Please be assured, I have forwarded your request to unsubscribe your number '9712534048' from getting the promotional notifications. It will take 3 working days to process it completely. You will only receive your order-related information.

Further, if you wish to unsubscribe from getting the promotional notifications on your email id too, I request you to open your latest promotional email and hit unsubscribe at the bottom right-hand side corner to stop email promotions.

I certainly hope this helps and appreciate your understanding and patience in the meanwhile. 
​
For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.

Regards,
Manisha

helpdesk_ticket.description:
*Dear PharmEasy Support Team,*

I am writing to raise a complaint regarding the delayed service for my home
blood sample collection, which I booked on *29th November 2025* for *30th
November 2025* (Order ID: *6216210*).

On the scheduled date, we waited for the technician, but no one informed us
that the technician would not be coming. After multiple follow-ups, I was
finally informed about the delay. At that time, I mentioned that my wife
had already been fasting for over 12 hours and requested to postpone the
collection since you had already delayed the visit.

Additionally, I requested a *cashback/refund as per your policy*, which was
promised at the time of booking. However, despite reporting this issue on *30th
November 2025*, I have not received any response or the cashback amount.

I kindly request you to *take immediate action as per your policy* and
process the refund/cashback at the earliest.

*Order Details:*

   - Order ID: *6216210*
   - Contact Number: *9987705622*

Looking forward to your prompt resolution.

*Regards,*
Pankaj Nikose

--

helpdesk_ticket.subject: Complaint Regarding Delayed Service and Pending Cashback – Order ID: 6216210
helpdesk_ticket.description_html:
Dear PharmEasy Support Team,
I am writing to raise a complaint regarding the delayed service for my home blood sample collection, which I booked on 29th November 2025 for 30th November 2025 (Order ID: 6216210).
On the scheduled date, we waited for the technician, but no one informed us that the technician would not be coming. After multiple follow-ups, I was finally informed about the delay. At that time, I mentioned that my wife had already been fasting for over 12 hours and requested to postpone the collection since you had already delayed the visit.
Additionally, I requested a cashback/refund as per your policy, which was promised at the time of booking. However, despite reporting this issue on 30th November 2025, I have not received any response or the cashback amount.
I kindly request you to take immediate action as per your policy and process the refund/cashback at the earliest.
Order Details:
  • Order ID: 6216210
  • Contact Number: 9987705622
Looking forward to your prompt resolution.
Regards,
Pankaj Nikose

helpdesk_ticket.description: Hi Mr. Rohan,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     We are in receipt of your booking for Mr. Rohan Ravsaheb Magdum for the Comprehensive Full Body Checkup with Vitamin D and B12 – 3, and your appointment was scheduled for sample collection on 1st Dec 2025. Phlebotomist Nikhil Subhash Jagtap was assigned for the same.     We understand that undergoing a health checkup should be a smooth and comfortable experience. However, on the day of your appointment, we received your complaint regarding a painful and improper sample collection process. We are truly sorry that you had to go through this discomfort—your well-being and trust are extremely important to us.     Based on your complaint, and as part of our commitment to maintaining high service standards, we have taken corrective action and discontinued the phlebotomist (Mr. Nikhil Subhash Jagtap) from sample collection duties.     As discussed, we had offered you a refund along with a complimentary sample collection for your next booking. However, since you chose not to proceed with the collection, we completely respect your decision.     As per your request, your order has been cancelled. An amount of Rs. 150 has been auto-refunded to your PharmEasy wallet, and Rs. 849 will be credited back to your original payment source within 5–7 working days.     We sincerely regret the inconvenience and distress this incident may have caused. Please rest assured that your feedback has been taken seriously, and we remain committed to improving your experience with us.     Thank you for your patience and understanding. We value your association with PharmEasy and hope to serve you better in the future.        Regards,  Kirtiratna Herode  Assistant Manager – Complaints & Redressals

We understand that undergoing a health checkup should be a smooth and comfortable experience. However, on the day of your appointment, we received your complaint regarding a painful and improper sample collection process. As discussed, we had offered you a refund along with a complimentary sample collection for your next booking. However, since you chose not to proceed with the collection, we completely respect your decision.

As per your request, your order has been cancelled. An amount of Rs. 150 has been auto-refunded to your PharmEasy wallet, and Rs. 849 will be credited back to your original payment source within 5–7 working days.

We sincerely regret the inconvenience and distress this incident may have caused. Please rest assured that your feedback has been taken seriously, and we remain committed to improving your experience with us.

Thank you for your patience and understanding. We value your association with PharmEasy and hope to serve you better in the future.


Regards,
Kirtiratna Herode
Assistant Manager – Complaints & Redressals

notes.body:
Hello Pharmeasy Team

Thank you for your response.

However, this looks like a standard / AI-generated template and does not
fully address the severity of my case.

I want to clearly place the following points on record:


   1.

   Proof of action taken

   You have mentioned that the phlebotomist “has been discontinued from
   sample collection duties.”

   -

      I request documented proof of this action (internal incident report /
      action taken note / confirmation from your Diagnostics/HR team),
as this is
      a matter of medical negligence and patient safety.

   2.

   Refund status

   You have stated that:

   -

      ₹150 has been refunded to the PharmEasy wallet: but its not refunded
      yet.
      -

      ₹849 will be credited to the original payment source in 5–7 working
      days

   As of now, the refund is not reflecting in my accounts.

   Please share:

   -

      Exact transaction details (UTR / reference number)
      -

      Expected date by which both amounts will be fully credited and
      visible at my end

   3.

   Current medical condition & compensation

   My hand is still swollen and painful due to the repeated failed attempts
   made by your technician.

   This is not just “discomfort”; it is a direct physical injury caused by
   your service provider.

   A simple refund does not close this matter.

   Once again, I am asking for:

   -

      Full refund (which you have initiated but not completed in my account
      yet), and
      -

      Compensation of ₹1,00,000 for:

      -

         Physical injury and swelling
         -

         Pain and medical risk
         -

         Mental stress and trauma
         -

         Deficiency in service and negligence

      I expect this compensation issue to be resolved within the next 24
   hours.

   If this is not done, I will be initiating formal legal action against
   PharmEasy, including but not limited to:

   -

      Filing a complaint under the Consumer Protection Act, 2019
      -

      Approaching the Consumer Court / appropriate legal forum
      -

      Submitting a written complaint to health and regulatory authorities

   4.

   Do not close the ticket

   This issue is not resolved, and a generic apology plus an unconfirmed
   refund does not settle a case of medical negligence.

   I request you to keep this ticket open until:

   -

      Refund is fully received and confirmed by me, and
      -

      Compensation is processed and credited



Please escalate this email to a Senior Manager / Grievance Redressal
Officer and respond with:


   -

   Proof of action taken against the technician
   -

   Refund transaction details
   -

   Clear decision and timeline on compensation


Looking forward to a concrete, actionable response rather than a generic
template reply.



*Thanks & Regards,*
*Rohan Magdum.*

notes.body: Hi Mr. Rohan,  Greetings from PharmEasy!  With reference to the email below, we understand that your experience was impacted while availing our services.  As informed earlier, we have taken corrective action and discontinued the phlebotomist (Mr. Nikhil Subhash Jagtap) from sample collection duties.        We had also offered you a refund along with a complimentary sample collection for your next booking, but the offer was declined.  Additionally, an amount of Rs. 150 has been auto-refunded to your PharmEasy wallet, and Rs. 849 has been refunded to your original payment source (RRN: 570108300081). The amount is expected to reflect in your account within 5–7 working days.  Refund transaction for your reference -.   We regret to inform you that your request for additional compensation could not be processed.  Further, due to a miscommunication, another phlebotomist contacted you today for sample collection. We have sensitized him to avoid such escalations in the future.  We sincerely regret the inconvenience and distress caused. Please be assured that your feedback has been taken seriously, and we remain committed to improving your experience with us.   Regards, Kirtiratna Herode Assistant Manager – Complaints & Redressals

notes.body:
Hello Mr Kirtiratna,

Thank you for getting back to me. I am placing the following points on
record:

*1. Refund Not Received*
Despite your repeated claims, *no refund has been reflected in my bank
account or on my payment method*.
Until the refund is physically visible at my end, you can't claim about
refund.
Please provide:

   -

   *Proof of refund completion*, not just internal screenshots
   -

   *UTR / bank transaction details*
   -

   *Timestamp and transaction channel*

*2. Continued Harassment & Unauthorised Calls*
Today, another phlebotomist repeatedly contacted me from a different number.
He spoke in a high and aggressive tone and demanded my address.
I want to know clearly:

   -

   *Who authorised him to contact me?*
   -

   *Why was my personal number shared with him without my consent?*
   -

   *Under what authority was he given access to my case details?*

This is a *serious data privacy violation*, and I have *all call recordings*
.

*3. My Health Condition*
My hands are still *swollen and painful* due to repeated failed attempts by
your technician.
I am dealing with a physical injury caused directly by PharmEasy’s
negligence.

A refund is not compensation.
Once again, I am demanding:

   -

   *Full refund*
   -

   *₹1,00,000 compensation* for injury, pain, trauma, risk to health, and
   service deficiency

If you do not want to provide what I rightfully deserve, I will proceed
through *legal channels* under the Consumer Protection Act, 2019.

*4. Inconsistent Statements About Action Taken*
Yesterday, you said that the technician was *suspended*.
Today, you claim he is “discontinued from sample collection activities.”

If he is truly removed for safety reasons:

   -

   Could you provide the termination letter or official disciplinary action
   document?

Otherwise, it is clear that you are misrepresenting the *facts* to close
the ticket.


*Stop minimising this as a simple service issue. Your company has caused
medical injury and is continuing to mishandle the situation.*

You are responsible for:

   -

   Negligent medical practice
   -

   Data privacy breach
   -

   Mental harassment
   -

   Miscommunication and misleading statements

I expect a *properly documented response*, not template repetitions.


*Thanks & Regards,*
*Rohan Magdum.*

You can refer to Escalated ticket #22241594.     I appreciate your patience in the meantime.     Regards,  Tahera

Post initiation, the refund will be credited to your source account within 3-5 business days. Please note that Saturday, Sunday, and bank holidays are not included in this.     A Promotional discount of Rs. 51.88 is credited to your PharmEasy wallet. To check your PharmEasy Wallet balance, go to the accounts section and click on the Wallet section to see the balance amount. This amount will expire on 31.05.2026 at 11:59 PM.   For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels on the app or website listed in the "Need Help" section.  Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Safe.  Regards, PharmEasy
notes.body_html:
Hello Ravi,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

This email is in regard to order #652692333891543040-65492.

A refund of Rs. 200.02 is initiated to your account. Post initiation, the refund will be credited to your source account within 3-5 business days. Please note that Saturday, Sunday, and bank holidays are not included in this. 
 
A Promotional discount of Rs. 51.88 is credited to your PharmEasy wallet. To check your PharmEasy Wallet balance, go to the accounts section and click on the Wallet section to see the balance amount. This amount will expire on 31.05.2026 at 11:59 PM. 

For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels on the app or website listed in the "Need Help" section.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Safe.

Regards,
PharmEasy

helpdesk_ticket.description:
Hi,

This is with reference to my order placed yesterday using my mobile number
9892104166. Since this morning, the order has been on hold as I missed a
confirmation call.


After missing the call, I immediately contacted your customer care. I was
informed that I would receive a confirmation call shortly. However, even
after 3 hours, I did not receive any call. When I followed up again, I was
informed that the hold would be removed soon. Even after another 2–3 hours,
the order status remained unchanged.


On my third follow-up, I was asked to contact 080-6241562 for order
confirmation , which turned out to be an invalid number. I had to call
customer care again for the fourth time, and once again I was told that I
would receive a confirmation call shortly. Till now, no confirmation call
has been received and the order is still on hold, even though the delivery
was scheduled for today.


At the same time, I had placed another medicine order through the Tata 1mg
app, and that order was delivered today without any follow-ups, while my
PharmEasy order remains pending after multiple calls and repeated
assurances.


I request you toImmediately remove the hold and confirm my order.

Also, kindly review your confirmation process, as it is causing unnecessary
delays and inconvenience to customers. Other competitors are delivering
orders smoothly without such manual confirmation steps.


I look forward to an urgent resolution.


Thanks,


Rejo

9892104166

--

helpdesk_ticket.subject: Order on Hold Due to Missed Confirmation Call – Poor Customer Support Experience
helpdesk_ticket.description_html:
Hi,

This is with reference to my order placed yesterday using my mobile number 9892104166. Since this morning, the order has been on hold as I missed a confirmation call.

After missing the call, I immediately contacted your customer care. I was informed that I would receive a confirmation call shortly. However, even after 3 hours, I did not receive any call. When I followed up again, I was informed that the hold would be removed soon. Even after another 2–3 hours, the order status remained unchanged.

On my third follow-up, I was asked to contact 080-6241562 for order confirmation , which turned out to be an invalid number. I had to call customer care again for the fourth time, and once again I was told that I would receive a confirmation call shortly. Till now, no confirmation call has been received and the order is still on hold, even though the delivery was scheduled for today.

At the same time, I had placed another medicine order through the Tata 1mg app, and that order was delivered today without any follow-ups, while my PharmEasy order remains pending after multiple calls and repeated assurances.

I request you toImmediately remove the hold and confirm my order.
Also, kindly review your confirmation process, as it is causing unnecessary delays and inconvenience to customers. Other competitors are delivering orders smoothly without such manual confirmation steps.

I look forward to an urgent resolution.

Thanks,

Rejo
9892104166

notes.body: Hello Rejo,     Greetings from PharmEasy!    We understand that you have a concern with the confirmation call you received after placing an order.     The intention of the call was to confirm the medicines ordered by you and to ensure that you receive the correct medicines on time.          I have highlighted the issue to the Operations team regarding the order #654166566832414720-38070. We will respond with the update as soon as we receive any from them.     I appreciate your patience in the meantime.     Regards,  Habiba
notes.body_html:
Hello Rejo,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

We understand that you have a concern with the confirmation call you received after placing an order.

helpdesk_ticket.description:
Dear Team,

I am writing to propose my *commercial property located in Peenya 2nd
Stage, GKW Layout, Bengaluru* as a potential site for one of your pharmacy
outlets. The building is currently *under construction*, providing
flexibility to tailor the space to your brand’s operational and layout
requirements.
------------------------------
*? Exact Location*

   -

   *Area:* Peenya 2nd Stage, GKW Layout, Bengaluru
   -

   *Latitude:* 13.009939279353823
   -

   *Longitude:* 77.51494883648269
   (Verifiable via Google Maps.)

------------------------------
*? Property Highlights*

   -

   *Plot Size:* 30 × 40 ft (approx. 111.5 sq.m)
   -

   *Site Type:* *Corner site* with visibility from two roads
   -

   *Front Road Width:* 9 metres
   -

   *Structure:* *Basement + Ground + 3 Floors*
   -

   *Status:* Under construction (ideal for medical store planning)

------------------------------
*⭐ Why This Location Is Ideal for a Pharmacy*

   -

   Located in a *dense residential and commercial zone*
   -

   High daily footfall from local residents, workers, and commuters
   -

   Corner-site offers *maximum visibility for signage and branding*
   -

   Easy access for walk-in customers and delivery personnel
   -

   Strong neighbourhood demand for reliable medicine and wellness services
   -

   Peaceful surroundings suitable for health & wellness retail
   -

   Basement can be used for staff parking or storage, depending on need

------------------------------
*?️ Customisation Options Available*

Since the building is under development, we can accommodate:

   -

   Ground floor layout per pharmacy standards
   -

   Storage racks and backroom area design
   -

   Air conditioning, refrigeration, and medicine storage requirements
   -

   Power backup and electrical load enhancements
   -

   Branding-friendly façade
   -

   Customer entry/exit flow design
   -

   Structural adjustments if required

------------------------------
*? Contact Details*

*Name:* Vinay GS**
*Mobile:* 9686861646**
*Email:* vinay4159@gmail.com**

I would be happy to share floor plans, site photos, or arrange a visit at
your convenience.
Thank you for considering this opportunity. I look forward to the
possibility of partnering with your brand at this location.

Warm regards,
*Vinay GS*
Property Owner

--
